title: Herbalife Releases Second Global Sustainability Report :: Herbalife Ltd. (HLF) - Investor Relations :: Herbalife Ltd. (HLF)
summary: Herbalife, a global health and wellness company, released its second Global Sustainability Report, highlighting its commitments to product quality, healthy people and communities, and a thriving planet. The report covers impacts from 2021-2022, showcasing achievements in areas like product innovation, environmental stewardship, and social responsibility.

title: East Penn Manufacturing power a closed loop circular economy - Sustainability Magazine
summary: East Penn Manufacturing, a long-standing lead battery manufacturer, prioritizes sustainability in its operations. The company focuses on a circular economy by recycling and reusing battery components, including lead, plastic, and acid. Their commitment to sustainability extends to employee support through programs like healthcare and training, and they are actively pursuing renewable energy sources, including a 15-megawatt solar project.

title: PFAS Anyone? - Textile World Magazine
summary: The article discusses the growing consumer demand for environmentally friendly products and the subsequent shift in the textile industry towards sustainability. It highlights the increasing importance of transparency in supply chains and the need for businesses to embrace sustainable practices. The article also explores the debate surrounding the use of PFAS in textiles, emphasizing the need for innovation and alternatives to harmful chemicals.

title: Why DE&I is Key to Business Sustainability: Considerations for Incorporating It into Your Plan - Security Management Magazine
summary: The article argues that diversity, equity, and inclusion (DE&I) are crucial for business sustainability. It emphasizes that DE&I can attract talent, improve employee retention, enhance team performance, generate ideas, and gain a competitive advantage. The article uses Axis Communications as an example, showcasing their progress in increasing gender diversity within their management positions and highlighting the importance of creating an inclusive work environment.

title: All the latest on ethically sourced ingredients - dairyfoods.com
summary: The dairy industry is facing growing consumer demand for ethically sourced ingredients, driving a shift towards practices that prioritize animal welfare, environmental sustainability, and worker treatment.  Retailers like Whole Foods Market are leading the way by offering products with certifications like 'cage-free plus' and 'pasture-raised', while dairy processors are adopting the U.S. Dairy Stewardship Commitment to demonstrate their commitment to ethical sourcing. The increasing emphasis on ethical sourcing reflects a growing awareness among consumers, particularly younger generations, who are willing to pay more for products that meet their ethical and sustainability standards.
likely_naics_codes: ['311111 - Dairy Product Manufacturing', '445110 - Supermarkets and Other Grocery (except Convenience) Stores', '445210 - Meat Markets', '424410 - Grocery and Related Product Wholesalers']
greenwashing: The article highlights the importance of transparency and authenticity in ethical sourcing, implying that greenwashing, or misleading claims about sustainability, is a concern within the industry and should be avoided.

title: Task force to tackle construction waste in Manitoba - Daily Commercial News
summary: Manitoba is forming a task force to explore ways to increase the recycling of construction and demolition (CRD) waste materials, diverting them from landfills and creating new products. This initiative aims to increase the province's recycling rate, which is currently one of the lowest in Canada, and aligns with the goal of transitioning to a circular economy where waste is minimized and reused. The task force will be examining best practices from other jurisdictions and consulting with stakeholders to develop recommendations for the government.

greenwashing: The article does not suggest any evidence of greenwashing.

title: Expansion of Evonik's methionine production capacity in Singapore moves to next stage - Aquafeed.com
summary: Evonik is expanding its DL-methionine production plant in Singapore, which will increase its production capacity by 40,000 metric tons per year. To complete the expansion, the company will temporarily shut down production for three months in Q4/2023 and another three months in H1/2024. This expansion is designed to improve efficiency and reduce the carbon footprint of the facility by 6%.

title: Jindal Group Makes a Grand Comeback: Snaps up Sohar Steel After Three-Year Break - ChemAnalyst
summary: Jindal Group has acquired Sohar Steel in Oman, marking its return to the steel industry after a three-year break. The acquisition signifies Jindal Group's commitment to Oman's economic diversification and sustainable development. The acquisition is expected to revitalize the plant, create jobs, and contribute to the sultanate's infrastructure.
